cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':'`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'`
fi
hear_shout.feature:
Feature: Hearing a shout

    Shouts have a range of approximately 1000 metres
        
     Background:
        Given Lucy is at 0, 0
     
     @complete
     Scenario: Multiple shouters
        Given people are located at
            |name  | x     | y |
            | Sean | 0     | 500 |
            | Oscar | 1100 | 0 |
        When Sean shouts
        And Oscar shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear Oscar
        But Lucy should hear Sean
     
     @complete
     Scenario: Multiple shouts from one person
        Given Sean is at 0, 500
        When Sean shouts
        And Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear 2 shouts from Sean
        
     @complete
     Scenario: Shouters should not hear their own shouts
        When Oscar shouts
        Then Oscar should not hear herself
     
     @complete
     Scenario Outline: only hear in-range shouts
        Given Sean is at <Seans-location>
        When Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear <what-Lucy-hears>
        
        Examples: some simple examples
            | Seans-location    | what-Lucy-hears |
            | 0, 900            | Sean            |
            | 800, 800          | nothing         |
output:
DoNotDisturbSteps.java:17: error: cannot find symbol
        shouty.setDND(from, to);       
              ^
  symbol:   method setDND(String,String)
  location: variable shouty of type Shouty
1 error
do_not_disturb.feature:
Feature: Do Not Disturb

    Users should have the ability to mute certain shouts for 
    a period of time
    
    @wip
    Scenario: User can mute some shouts for an indefinite time
        Given Lucy sets Do Not Disturb on Sean
        When Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear Sean
